description: Quality checks that apply to ALL domains. These always run in addition to domain-specific checks.

checks.name: Hallucination Prevention
checks.description: Verify no fabricated content exists in deliverables
criteria: All factual claims have verifiable sources (URL, doc reference, or data file)
No invented statistics, names, dates, or citations
Uncertain claims flagged with [NEEDS VERIFICATION] rather than fabricated
Sources cited inline and/or in a references section

checks.name: Internal Consistency
checks.description: Verify deliverable is internally consistent and aligned with project context
criteria: No contradictions within the deliverable itself
Cross-referenced against AGENTS.md and progress.txt for alignment
Numbers, dates, and names consistent across all sections

checks.name: Traceability
checks.description: Every output traces back to a defined requirement
criteria: Every deliverable traces back to a PRD requirement or acceptance criterion
No scope creep beyond defined tasks
All changes documented in progress.txt with clear rationale

checks.name: Completeness
checks.description: All required content is present with no gaps
criteria: All acceptance criteria addressed and verifiable
No placeholder text remaining (no TODO, FIXME, TBD, or lorem ipsum)
No sections left empty or partially filled
Edge cases and error states considered where applicable

passCriteria: ALL universal checks must pass. These are non-negotiable quality gates applied to every task regardless of domain.
